comments.html:
In theory, it could. The RFC states in the overview section "Note that this document assumes that the preference policy for the
host destination address favors IPv6 over IPv4". There are more details, so you might want to read the whole RFC.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Thanks for clarification. So to me there's a trade off between going to the whole list with those 2 delay timers for finding the best performing destination versus going for the first received addresses but maybe getting a bad performing destination. It will be interesting to see if the Apple consumers appreciate this approach.
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: Does this mean that the browser could try to connect via IPv4 first? Well that would be a step back or turning around in a circle.
comments.name: Anonymous
